column4: does anyone know why a dual processor computer would appear as only haveing one in bot windows and ubuntu?
h3ris, its not a core issue, its two processors.
ok, are there two processors recognized in the boot messages?
yes, it says it has two p3 processors, at 550 MHZ
also, do "uname -a" and look for "SMP" in the middle
nope nothing like that, it says it has a Seimens Multiprocessor Interrupt Controller, does that have anything to do with it?
Linux p3-dual 2.6.15-26-386 #1 PREEMPT Thu Aug 3 02:52:00 UTC 2006 i686 GNU/Linux
ok, your kernel can't do multiprocessors
anyone know which dapper kernel has SMP?
you can do "aptitude search linux-image" to find which kernel packages are available
and then "sudo aptitude install linux-image-whatev-12345" once you decide on one to install
